p: From the 1960s to1980s, CHIKV outbreaks were limited to Africa and Asia. In 2004, it re-emerged in Kenya and rapidly spread to several islands in the Indian Ocean as well as many other regions, including South Asia, Central and West Africa, Europe, the Caribbean and Central, South and North America served to refocus global attention to this virus [ 25]. Characterizing the whole viral genome and cell tropism contributes to better understand the pathogenesis and vector competence of CHIKV.
